intro: Mentha flavescens, commonly known as yellow mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, narrow, and slightly serrated leaves that have a minty fragrance. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pale yellow or greenish-white, appearing in whorled clusters. Mentha flavescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
